item.title: Anthropic signs $200M deal to bring its LLMs to Snowflake’s customers
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: AI research lab Anthropic inked a $200 million deal with Snowflake to bring its AI models to Snowflake's 12,600 customers.

item.title: EU investigating Meta over policy change that bans rival AI chatbots from WhatsApp
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: The European Commission is is launching an antitrust investigation into Meta's move to ban other AI companies from using WhatsApp's business tools to offer their own AI chatbots to users.

item.title: AI finds its way into Apple’s top apps of the year
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Although Apple has continued to avoid naming a dedicated AI app or AI chatbot as its app of the year, AI was showcased among this year's winners.

item.title: Nexus isn’t going all-in on AI, keeping half of its new $700M fund for India startups
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Nexus Venture Partners manages $3.2 billion in capital across its funds and has invested in more than 130 companies over the years.

item.title: Gemini was Google’s top trending search term in 2025
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Gemini wasn’t the only AI chatbot to make the list, as DeepSeek ranked seventh among the year’s trending searches.

item.title: New unicorn Brevo raises $583M to challenge CRM giants
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Brevo, a customer relationship management company headquartered in Paris, is now a unicorn.

item.title: Day One Ventures’ Masha Bucher on why every founder needs to be an influencer
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Tech is racing ahead while society struggles to keep up. Masha Bucher, founder and GP of Day One Ventures, built her firm around closing that gap by combining venture capital with hands-on PR to help portfolio companies not just raise money, but actually break through the noise.   Day One’s been an early backer of companies like World, Superhuman, and Remote.com, with 12 […]

item.title: Amazon hopes to jump-start its AI coding tool Kiro by giving it away to startups
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Can Kiro win the hearts of startup founders above the many AI coding tools they already have? Amazon hopes a free year will tempt them.

item.title: All the biggest news from AWS’ big tech show re:Invent 2025
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec, Julie Bort, Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Amazon Web Services' giant tech conference re:Invent 2025 is happening this week with news ranging from chips to AI services.

item.title: Meta poaches Apple design exec Alan Dye to lead new creative studio in Reality Labs
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Dye led Apple's user interface team for the last decade.

item.title: Could MrBeast IPO? His CEO wants fans to have ‘a chance to be owners of the company’
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Three years ago, the idea of a YouTuber with a $1.5 billion valuation left some onlookers incredulous -- but Beast Industries ended up raising at a $5 billion valuation last year. Now we're asking a bigger question: Would you buy stock in a 27-year-old named Jimmy?

item.title: Roblox banned in Russia, local media says
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Russia's communications agency cited the presence of LGBTQ content on the platform as one of the reasons behind the ban.

item.title: Andy Jassy says Amazon’s Nvidia competitor chip is already a multibillion-dollar business
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Can any company, big or small, really topple Nvidia's AI chip dominance? Maybe not entirely, but Amazon is already making big bucks trying.

item.title: Trump administration rolls back fuel economy standards, again
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The regulatory decision would make it harder for future administrations to implement stricter fuel efficiency standards.

item.title: WordPress’s vibe-coding experiment, Telex, has already been put to real-world use
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Though WordPress's Telex is still an experiment, the vibe-coding software has already been used to help build real-world websites.

item.title: VCs deploy ‘kingmaking’ strategy to crown AI winners in their infancy
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: While VCs have long used big investments to spur category winners, they are taking this strategy to new extremes.

item.title: ‘End-to-end encrypted’ smart toilet camera is not actually end-to-end encrypted
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Kohler, the makers of a smart toilet camera, can access customers' data stored on its servers, and can use customers’ bowl pictures to train AI.

item.title: Company backed by Donald Trump Jr.’s firm nabs $620M government contract
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Vulcan Elements, a rare-earth magnets startup, has secured a $620 million contract from the U.S. defense department.

item.title: Tonight, the future of deep tech will be explained to you at StrictlyVC Palo Alto
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: On Wednesday evening at Playground Global in Palo Alto, some very smart people who are building things you don't understand yet will explain what's coming. This is the final StrictlyVC event of 2025, and truly, the lineup is ridiculous.

item.title: Fintech firm Marquis alerts dozens of US banks and credit unions of a data breach after ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Marquis said ransomware hackers stole reams of banking customer data, containing personal information and financial records, as well as Social Security numbers, belonging to hundreds of thousands of people. The number of affected people is expected to rise.
